required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Multiparametric Diagnostic Model of Thick-section Clinical-quality MRI Data in Detecting Migraine Without Aura
clinical_study.official_title: Multiparametric Diagnostic Model of Thick-section Clinical-quality MRI Data in Detecting Migraine Without Aura

brief_summary.textblock: Recently, radiomics combined with machine learning method has been widely used in clinical practice. Compared with traditional imaging studies that explore the underlying mechanisms, the machine learning method focuses on classification and prediction to propose personalized diagnosis and treatment strategies. However, these studies were based on thin-section research-quality brain MR imaging with section thickness of < 2 mm. Clinical, the usage of thick-section clinical setting instead of thin-section research setting is especially important to shorten the acquisition time to reduce the patient's suffering. Here investigators want to build multiparametric diagnostic model of migraineurs without aura using radiomics features extracted from thick-section clinical-quality brain MR images.

primary_outcome.description: a measure of statistical bias which measures the proportion of health controls and migrainures that are correctly identified as such.
true positive rate of detection in migraineurs which measures the proportion of actual migraineurs that are correctly identified as such.
true negative rate measures the proportion of actual health controls that are correctly identified as such.

intervention.description: using radiomics features from multiparametric thick-section clinical-quality brain MRI to distinguish migraineurs from health controls.

study_pop.textblock: 200 migraineurs without aura 200 age- and gender-matched health controls (HCs)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- right-handed
- International Headache Society criteria for episodic migraine without aura
Exclusion Criteria:
- addition (including alcohol, nicotine, or drug)
- physical illness
